channel.title: Readings on Industrial Organization
channel.description: Recent content in Readings on Industrial Organization

item.title: 1.2. Technology and Cost - Readings
item.description: Required Readings: NONE Recommended Readings: This is a part of our review of major production concepts from Microeconomics. You should consider looking at the following textbooks if you are rusty or want to know more about these concepts: Ch. 2: pp.29-40 in Dennis W Carlton and Jeffrey M PerloffModern Industrial Organization, 4th ed. (USA: Pearson, 2005). Ch. 2.1-2.2, 3.1 in Jeffrey Church and Roger WareIndustrial Organization: A Strategic Approach (New York: McGraw-Hill, 2000).

item.title: 1.7. Monopoly III: Pricing - Readings
item.description: Required Readings: NONE Recommended Readings: This is a part of our review of major production concepts from Microeconomics. You should consider looking at the following textbooks if you are rusty or want to know more about these concepts: Ch. 9 in Dennis W Carlton and Jeffrey M PerloffModern Industrial Organization, 4th ed. (USA: Pearson, 2005). Ch. 2.1-2.2, 3.1 in Jeffrey Church and Roger WareIndustrial Organization: A Strategic Approach (New York: McGraw-Hill, 2000).

item.title: Discussion 1: Monopoly - Readings
item.description: Tuesday, February 18, 2020 Required Readings: Thiel (2014), “Zero to One” Chs. 3-5Sorry about the quality of the PDF if that is what you use to read it. The required reading starts on page 17, “All Happy Comapanies Are Different”, through the end of the document. This will be the first major reading and discussion that we will have this semester. On Thursday I will explain how we will hold discussions, as well as provide more context for you to interpret the readings.
